     because they are nice

      are they strange?

     most of them are not

     how strange are they

     the same amount as you

2.17.23  11:34 pm   what is a good question to ask

      what you want to know

2.17.23  10:48 pm   ok long question incoming. so recently i've been trying to use numbers to notate chords instead of just using specific chord symbols to the key (like 1m7 instead of Cm7). it seems like a good idea to get a good understanding of chord progressions and also to understand the relationships and how to transpose easily and quickly. i started doing this by using the real book and just translating them on a piece of paper. but i ran into this problem again and again and i really am stuck on it for some reason. Ok, so say we're in Cmin. an Abmaj7 chord appears. if the Cmin chord is the 1m, would the Abmaj7 be the 6maj7 (the 6th note of a C minor scale) or b6maj7 (the flat 6th of a C major scale)? i'm probably overthinking this but the b6maj7 feels better to me

      b6 would be the answer here. that's just how people do it. there is logic to calling it 6 but it's just not what you're gonna see people doing out in the world. the convention, for the most part, is to refer to the Ab chord as b6 in the key of C or Cmin. and 6maj would be Amaj which you'd be certainly not likely to see in Cmin but for example you'd be likely to see 6dom7 in the key of C, with a likelyhood of 2min (Dmin) after it, etc

2.17.23  8:58 pm   Congratulations on the Vibe Chamber interview! it came out great!
It was a bit short but it was good :)

Do you think you've improved as a guest from your previous appearances on other shows?

      not yet, but it's on my to-do list

2.17.23  7:51 pm   how to swiftly bullshit twenty thousand words for work, internship, and college applications? i specifically included "swiftly" because i'm finding less and less time for my actual passions (which unfortunately are polar opposites to what i MUST apply to) beyond all of this bullshit. fml

      you're in luck, someone recently invented a bullshit machine

2.17.23  6:44 pm   So, on "wait , no stop the show" I've thus far worked out that it's either a g major in second inversion or some kinda c maj 7 with some add 9s and such. But I feel as if I'm barking up the wrong tree

      it's a lot of Csus2maj7

2.17.23  5:41 pm   If you wrote la de da de da de da de day oh in 2012,

     only until the end of the first chorus. everything after that was written in october 2017.

     then why didn't you make it until 2018?

     actually i made most of it near the end of 2017, and the reason i didn't make it in 2012 is because i was busy writing more songs. the reason i didn't do it in 2013 is because i was still writing more songs and doing some video production experiments and working on building a website. i didn't do it in 2014 because i launched a 5-day-per-week release schedule that never would have allowed for a full length song+video. i didn't do it in 2015 because i did 'crazy/raining' and 'free to' instead, while also keeping a steady schedule of short videos and near the end of the year doing history of japan. i didn't do it in 2016 because i was making the reality section and making all the clips for 2010-2016, then i launched sequence of increasing length videos and when i got up to full length songs i chose 'day goes on' and 'hallelujah' but then actually switched to a huge history video before even those got produced, then i spent a whole year doing that, then soon after in 2017 it was time to do songs. and the reason i didn't do it in june 2017 was because i chose 4 other songs instead, and the reason i didn't do it in july is because i did "hi i'm steve" instead, and the reason i didn't do it in august/september is because i chose 'movie star' and 'outside' instead, and the reason i didn't do it in early october is because i chose 'soap tips' instead.

2.17.23  3:30 pm   favorite flavor of ice cream?

      kitchen sink

2.17.23  2:55 pm   Why do you think people imagine they should be somewhere other than where they are? Is there truth to it?

      sure. this is contemplating purposeful change

2.17.23  2:02 pm   hi bill, so this might be a weird question, but you're one of the few people I know of who keep things real and down to earth. so recently I noticed that I was actively avoiding listening to a few songs that I'd vibed hard with. odd thing is they're all from this one timeframe, october 2021. that's very strange, since they're really good songs in my opinion. does this happen to you as well?

     i think so

     like they're just uncomfortable to listen to. I know you try not to listen to your old songs. does that share anything in common with this phenomenon?

     maybe a little bit, but i think that would be even more sensitive because i'm actually responsible for creating the songs

     because so far I kinda have a theory as to why it's happening for me. that was around the time I made some very bad choices, and they rewarded me at that time. as a result, I continued with it, a habit I have only recently been able to foresee the consequences of and have begun undoing (no it's not robbery or anything like that. more like self-deception). maybe I just don't want to be reminded of the time where everything took a turn for the awful?

     yes, i think that makes sense

      I understand if you don't want to respond to this since it's basically me venting using your page to do so. but I'm feeling better already :)

2.17.23  1:32 pm   Is the world simply what lives in the universe? So the world can be bad, but that doesn't mean that the universe is?

      i think the world means like..... the whole place. but no one's ever been all there, so we don't quite know

2.17.23  8:59 am   what's the wackiest time signature you've ever written in

      it sounds like you're looking for something where the time signature stays the same, even though that's definitely not the wackiest you can do with time signatures, nor is it the wackiest i've done with them. However, if we're only including non-changing time signatures then the answer would probably be the 'violence' outtro of ball and stick which should be 13/16 if i remember correctly

If you do, do you still decide to work on them/does that make it any harder to work on them than if it was a song you still related to? If you don't, disregard that last question

2.16.23  6:40 pm   Can I get the chords for the "and the gameplay makes the game fade away" coz I've spend ages tryna figure it out. Ik the bit before had some e and b major 7 stuff going on but I was intrigued to find out where it went from there

      on "gameplay" it's like F#min11 (maybe something like Eadd4/F# is a better way to explain it). on "fade" it goes to like F#sus2sus4 but then it switches on "away" to more like F#maj9

2.15.23  4:37 pm   this crummy feeling i get whenever i'm not productive is becoming a more and more present issue in my life. even when i don't have the energy or finish a big project and feel i should take a break for a day i just go back to feeling bad. what do i do? is working constantly the only answer because i don't think i could keep that up

      it's time to remember what exactly the big project is. what it was when you started it, how it felt, why you wanted it, etc. What if you had to explain these things to someone, such as a duck, right now?
